system: REST API for user authentication and session management. The API provides endpoints for user registration, login, logout, and password reset. JWT tokens are used for authentication with a 24-hour expiration. Rate limiting is implemented at 100 requests per minute per IP address. User passwords are hashed using bcrypt with a cost factor of 10.
context: The API is built with Node.js/Express and uses PostgreSQL for user data storage.
JWT tokens are signed with a secret key stored in environment variables.
Rate limiting uses an in-memory store (node-cache) that resets on server restart.
Password reset tokens are sent via email and expire after 1 hour.
The API is deployed behind an nginx reverse proxy with SSL termination.
Session data (JWT claims) includes: userId, email, role, and expiration timestamp.
